text: Google "Wreck of the Pendleton". This is a true story and for those that complain that there aren't any hoods or thug characters in it, Do your damned research before opening your mouth. Life of Pi whiners ... Pi was a made up tale .. this is NOT and, up until recently, the remains of the wreck could be seen with binoculars at low tide here. I just hope that the trailer matches the film and that Disney has done the story justice. I watched them film this on location on Cape Cod where it actually happened and it was looking good then. Will be seeing both this and Alice.

author: Teresa Johnson

text: Back in the mid-70's  i was stationed at a lifeboat station on the Oregon Coast. We had one of the last 36 foot motor lifeboats still in commission at the time (along with two 44 footers)...the 36498. The craft depicted here is the 36500.  From experience, those old 36 footer were capable rescue boats, but I sure would not want to be out in one during those kind of conditions. To do what they did using one of those old boats in that kind weather was truly incredible.
